links.title: Kafka Lag Exporter
links.tooltip: Open Kafka Lag Exporter dashboard (when corresponding Lag Exporter is enabled).

links.title: Node Details
links.tooltip: Open Node Details dashboard for external managed Kafka node exporter.

panels.description: Current status of Kafka cluster
panels.title: Cluster Status

panels.description: Current size of Kafka cluster
panels.title: Cluster Size

panels.description: Current count of ready pods. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.

targets.expr: sum(kube_pod_status_ready{exported_namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster", exported_pod=~"$broker.*", condition="true"}) OR on() vector(-1)

panels.title: Ready Pods

panels.description: Current state of controller broker. The controller changes state when processing an event. Most of the time, the Idle state is displayed, which means that the controller has processed all the events. If the event processing takes a considerable time (several seconds or more), this state of the controller will be displayed. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Controller State

panels.description:
Current controller broker.
The first node to boot in a Kafka cluster automatically becomes the controller, and there can be only one. The controller in a Kafka cluster is responsible for maintaining the list of partition leaders, and coordinating leadership transitions (in the event a partition leader becomes unavailable). If it becomes necessary to replace the controller, a new controller is randomly chosen by ZooKeeper from the pool of brokers. In general, it is not possible for this value to be greater than one, but you should definitely alert on a value of zero
panels.title: Controller Broker

panels.description: Kafka version running on controller broker
panels.title: Kafka Version

panels.description: Transitions of Kafka cluster statuses
panels.title: Cluster Status Transitions

panels.description: Transitions of controller broker states. The controller changes state when processing an event. Most of the time, the Idle state is displayed, which means that the controller has processed all the events. If the event processing takes a considerable time (several seconds or more), this state of the controller will be displayed
panels.title: Controller State Transitions

panels.description: Transitions of readiness probes for each Kafka pod. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Pod Readiness Probe Transitions

panels.description: Information about brokers configuration consistency
panels.title: Similar Configs

panels.description: Information about broker states, number of partitions replicas on each broker, number of partitions where current broker is a leader, skews and number of under replicated partitions
panels.title: Brokers

panels.description: The number of under-replicated partitions. Replicas that are added as part of a reassignment will not count toward this value
panels.title: Under Replicated Partitions

panels.description: The number of partitions whose in-sync replicas (ISR) count is less than `minIsr`
panels.title: Under Min ISR Partitions

panels.description: The number of partitions that dont have an active leader and are hence not writable or readable
panels.title: Offline Partitions

panels.description: The number of partitions which have open transactions with durations exceeding `transaction.max.timeout.ms` (plus 5 minutes)
panels.title: Partitions With Late Transactions

panels.description: The rate of errors in responses counted per error code. If a response contains multiple errors, all are counted
panels.title: Broker Errors Rate

panels.description: Total number of topics on Kafka cluster. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Total Topics Count

panels.description: Total number of partitions on Kafka cluster. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Total Partitions Count

panels.description: Number of max partitions per broker. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Max Partitions Per Broker

panels.description: List of topics which have at least one partition without a leader. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Topics Without Leader

panels.description: Number of partitions without an active leader. Because all read and write operations are only performed on partition leaders, a non-zero value for this metric should be alerted on to prevent service interruptions. Any partition without an active leader will be completely inaccessible, and both consumers and producers of that partition will be blocked until a leader becomes available
panels.title: Offline Partitions Count

panels.description: Count of topics which have at least one under replicated partition. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Under Replicated Topics

panels.description: Count of topics with unclean leader election enabled. Unclean leader elections can lead to data loss, so you should check these topics to see if this setting is set reasonably. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Topics With Unclean Leader Election Enabled

panels.description: Number of consumer groups in different states. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Consumer Groups Number

panels.description: JVM heap usage by broker. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: JVM Heap Usage

panels.description: JVM heap usage by broker in percent (%). May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.

targets.expr: (max(java_Memory_HeapMemoryUsage_used{namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster", broker=~"$broker"}) by (broker) / max(java_Memory_HeapMemoryUsage_max{namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster", broker=~"$broker"}) by (broker)) * 100

panels.title: JVM Heap Usage in Percent

panels.description: Garbage collection time rate per second by broker. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.

targets.expr: max(rate(java_GarbageCollector_CollectionTime{name="G1 Young Generation", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster", broker=~"$broker"}[$__interval])) by (broker) >= 0
max(rate(java_GarbageCollector_CollectionTime{name="G1 Old Generation", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster", broker=~"$broker"}[$__interval])) by (broker) >= 0

panels.title: GC Time

panels.description: Garbage collections count rate per second by broker. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.

targets.expr: max(rate(java_GarbageCollector_CollectionCount{name="G1 Young Generation", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster", broker=~"$broker"}[$__interval])) by (broker) >=0
max(rate(java_GarbageCollector_CollectionCount{name="G1 Old Generation", namespace="$namespace", cluster="$cluster", broker=~"$broker"}[$__interval])) by (broker) >=0

panels.title: GC Count

panels.description: Memory usage by pod. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Memory Usage

panels.description: CPU usage by pod. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: The total size in bytes of read operations on the volume for each broker. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Disk Read Bytes

panels.description: The total size in bytes of write operations on the volume for each broker. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Disk Write Bytes

panels.description: The total size in bytes of volume space occupied by topic partitions logs for each broker. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Topic Partition Data Size

panels.description: Total number of controller requests to be sent out to brokers
panels.title: Total Queue Size

panels.description: Size of ControllerEventManager's queue. Every ControllerEvent has an associated state. When a ControllerEvent is processed, it triggers a state transition to the requested state. ControllerEvent events are managed by ControllerEventManager
panels.title: Event Queue Size

panels.description: Time it takes for any event (except the Idle event) to wait in the ControllerEventManager's queue before being processed
panels.title: Event Queue Time Rate

panels.description: Aggregate incoming/outgoing byte rate per second
panels.title: Bytes In/Out

panels.description: Amount of data in bytes per second rejected by broker
panels.title: Bytes Rejected

panels.description: ZooKeeper session state for each broker. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: ZooKeeper Session State

panels.description: Rate of ZooKeeper requests. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: ZooKeeper Requests Rate

panels.description: Latency of ZooKeeper requests. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: ZooKeeper Requests Latency

panels.description: ISR expansion rate. If a broker goes down, ISR for some of the partitions will shrink. When that broker is up again, ISR will be expanded once the replicas are fully caught up. Other than that, the expected value for both ISR shrink rate and expansion rate is 0
panels.title: Isr Expands Rate

panels.description: ISR shrink rate. If a broker goes down, ISR for some of the partitions will shrink. When that broker is up again, ISR will be expanded once the replicas are fully caught up. Other than that, the expected value for both ISR shrink rate and expansion rate is 0
panels.title: Isr Shrinks Rate

panels.description: Aggregate incoming messages rate per second
panels.title: Message Rate

panels.description: Total fetch request rate per second
panels.title: Total Fetch Requests Rate

panels.description: Total produce request rate per second
panels.title: Total Produce Requests Rate

panels.description: Fetch request rate per second for requests that failed
panels.title: Failed Fetch Requests Rate

panels.description: Produce request rate per second for requests that failed
panels.title: Failed Produce Requests Rate

panels.description: Size of fetch queue. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Fetch Queue Size

panels.description: Size of request queue. A congested request queue will not be able to process incoming or outgoing requests
panels.title: Request Queue Size

panels.description: Number of live threads, including both daemon and non-daemon threads. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Thread Count

panels.description: Total number of threads created and also started since the JVM started. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Total Started Thread Count

panels.description: Information about configured and dead Log Cleaner and Replica Fetcher threads. May be not applicable for managed external Kafka.
panels.title: Log Cleaner And Replica Fetcher Threads
